get.description: Retrieves information, including status, about a purge request.

parameters.name: request_id
parameters.description: The purge request's system-defined ID. This ID is returned by the [Purge Cache operation](#tag/purge-requests/operation/postCacheV01PurgeRequests).

post.description: Submits a request to purge cached content from a specific environment. Purging content invalidates the cached version of an asset from our edge servers. You may submit up to 50 concurrent purge requests. For the purpose of concurrency, each value defined within the `values` property is considered a separate purge request. Find out the current status of your purge request by passing the purge request ID, which is returned by the `id` property, to the [Get Purge Request operation](#tag/purge-requests/operation/getCacheV01PurgeRequestsRequestId).

parameters.name: environment_redirect_id
parameters.description:
The bulk redirect's system-defined ID.

get.description: Returns a TLS certificate.

parameters.name: cert_id
parameters.description: The TLS certificate's system-defined ID. Use the [Get All Certificates operation](#tag/tls-certs/operation/getConfigV01TlsCerts) to retrieve a list of TLS certificates and their system-defined IDs.

post.description: Generates a Let's Encrypt certificate for each eligible hostname associated with the specified environment. A hostname is eligible for automatic certificate generation when the CA is allowed to issue certificates for that hostname and your control over the domain is established through an `_acme_challenge` CNAME record. [Learn more.](https://docs.edg.io/applications/basics/hostnames#https-traffic)
Upload your TLS certificate to activate it within a specific environment.

get.description: Returns all TLS certificates associated with an environment.

post.description: Deploys your configuration to a specific environment. This deployment overwrites any existing origin configurations, hostnames, rules, and experiments.

first.description: Link to the first page of results.

next.description: Link to the next page of results.

previous.description: Link to the previous page of results.

last.description: Link to the last page of results.

property_id.description: The system-defined ID for the property associated with this environment.

legacy_account_number.description: The system-defined account number for this environment. Use this account number when requesting legacy APIs. This account number is unavailable immediately after an environment is created. If it is missing, try retrieving the environment again.

only_maintainers_can_deploy.description: Determines whether Editors will be restricted to read-only access. Enabling this option restricts configuration and deployments to deploy tokens, Maintainers, and Admins.

http_request_logging.description: Determines whether deep-request inspection for serverless logs will be enabled.

default_domain_name.description: The default hostname through which traffic for this environment is served.

pci_compliance.description: Determines whether this environment's traffic will be restricted to our PCI-compliant network or served through our entire network.

dns_domain_name.description: Serve traffic for this environment by pointing your CNAMEs to this domain.

created_at.description: The environment's creation date and time (UTC).

updated_at.description: The environment's last modification date and time (UTC).

name.description: The environment's name. This name may only consist of lowercase characters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.

can_members_deploy.description: Determines whether all organization memmbers may deploy to this environment. Disabling this option restricts deployments to admin users and the deploy token.

http_request_logging.description: Determines whether deep-request inspection for serverless logs will be enabled.

preserve_cache.description: Determines whether deploying a new build to this environment will use the same cache as the previous deployment.

name.description: The environment's name. This name may only consist of lowercase characters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.

only_maintainers_can_deploy.description: Determines whether Editors will be restricted to read-only access. Enabling this option restricts configuration and deployments to deploy tokens, Maintainers, and Admins.

http_request_logging.description: Determines whether deep-request inspection for serverless logs will be enabled.

organization_id.description:
An organization's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired organization and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Organization ID**.

created_at.description: The property's creation date and time (UTC).

updated_at.description: The property's last modification date and time (UTC).

slug.description: The property's name. Space characters are converted to dashes.
The property's name. Space characters are converted to dashes.

organization_id.description: The system-defined ID for the organization under which this property will be created.

partner_id.description: The system-defined ID for the partner account under which the organization was created.

pci_compliance.description:
The organization's PCI compliance status. This state is determined by checking PCI-compliance across all environments associated with this organization. Valid values are:

-   **pci:** All environments are PCI-compliant.
-   **non_pci:** All environments use our entire network.
-   **mixed:** Some environments are PCI-compliant.

pci_dns_domain_name.description:
The organization's PCI-compliant DNS domain.

Serve traffic through our PCI-compliant network by pointing your CNAMEs to this domain.

non_pci_dns_domain_name.description:
The organization's DNS domain for standard traffic. Standard traffic can use our entire network.

Serve traffic that does not require PCI-compliance by pointing your CNAMEs to this domain.

created_at.description: The organization's creation date and time (UTC).

updated_at.description: The organization's last modification date and time (UTC).

status.description:
The purge request's status. Valid values are:
  - `in_progress`: Edgio is still purging content.
  - `done`: Edgio has purged the requested content.

created_at.description: The date and time (UTC) at which the purge request was submitted.

completed_at.description: The date and time (UTC) at which the purge request was completed.

environment_id.description:
An environment's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

purge_type.description:
- `all_entries`: Purge all cached content.
- `path`: Purge one or more relative path(s) defined within the `values` property.
- `surrogate_key`: Purge one or more surrogate key(s) defined within the `values` property.

values.description:
Defines the set of content to be purged. The `purge_type` property's value determines what should be passed.
  - `all_entries`: Omit this property or pass an empty array.
  - `path`: Pass one or more relative path(s). This relative path starts directly after the hostname.
  - `surrogate_key`: Pass one or more surrogate key(s) (aka cache tags).

hostname.description:
If specified, cached paths will only be purged for this specific hostname.
If omitted, the specified paths will be purged for all hostnames.

postCacheV01PurgeRequests.description: Submits a request to purge cached content from a specific environment. Purging content invalidates the cached version of an asset from our edge servers. You may submit up to 50 concurrent purge requests. For the purpose of concurrency, each value defined within the `values` property is considered a separate purge request. Find out the current status of your purge request by passing the purge request ID, which is returned by the `id` property, to the [Get Purge Request operation](#tag/purge-requests/operation/getCacheV01PurgeRequestsRequestId).

environment_id.description:
An environment's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

from.description: An absolute or relative URL that will be redirected.

to.description: An absolute or relative URL to which clients will be redirected.

status.description:
`3xx` status code for the response sent to the client.
Valid values are: `301 | 302 | 307 | 308`

forward_query_string.description: Determines whether the `Location` response header will include the requests query string.

created_at.description: The bulk redirect's creation date and time (UTC).

updated_at.description: The bulk redirect's last modification date and time (UTC).

environment_id.description:
An environment's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

from.description: An absolute or relative URL that will be redirected.

to.description: An absolute or relative URL to which clients will be redirected.

status.description: `3xx` status code for the response sent to the client. Valid values are: `301 | 302 | 307 | 308`

forward_query_string.description: Determines whether the `Location` response header will include the requests query string.

putConfigV01EnvironmentRedirects.description: Creates or updates a bulk redirect.

environment_id.description:
An environment's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

secret.description: Determines whether the environment variable's value will be partially masked using asterisks.

created_at.description: The environment variable's creation date and time (UTC).

updated_at.description: The environment variable's last modification date and time (UTC).

environment_id.description:
An environment's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

secret.description: Determines whether the environment variable's value will be partially masked using asterisks.

putConfigV01EnvironmentVariables.description: Creates or updates an environment variable.

environment_id.description:
An environment's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

primary_cert.description: Primary certificate. Not returned for records in collection.

intermediate_cert.description: Intermediate certificate. Not returned for records in collection

expiration.description: The TLS certificate's expiration date and time (UTC).

status.description:
The TLS certificate's status. Returns one of the following states:

-  `created`: The TLS certificate has been created, but it has not yet been activated.
-  `activating:` Edgio is in the process of activating the TLS certificate.
-  `activated:` The TLS certificate is currently active.
-  `failed:` The activation of the TLS certificate failed.
-  `expired:` The TLS certificate has expired.

generated.description: Returns `true` for TLS certificates generated by Edgio. Returns `false` for existing TLS certificates that were uploaded to Edgio.

alternative_names.description: The TLS certificate's Subject Alternative Names (SAN).

activation_error.description: Contains an error message if the TLS certificate could not be activated.

created_at.description: The TLS certificate's creation date and time (UTC).

updated_at.description: The TLS certificate's last modification date and time (UTC).

environment_id.description:
An environment's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

postConfigV01TlsCertsGenerate.description: Generates a Let's Encrypt certificate for each eligible hostname associated with the specified environment. A hostname is eligible for automatic certificate generation when the CA is allowed to issue certificates for that hostname and your control over the domain is established through an `_acme_challenge` CNAME record. [Learn more.](https://docs.edg.io/applications/basics/hostnames#https-traffic)

environment_id.description:
An environment's system-defined ID (e.g., 12345678-1234-1234-1234-1234567890ab).

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

primary_cert.description: Your TLS certificate. We require this certificate to be issued by a Certificate Authority.

intermediate_cert.description: The intermediate certificates (IC) used by the CA, including the CAs signing certificate.

private_key.description: The private key that was generated with the CSR.

postConfigV01TlsCerts.description: Upload your TLS certificate to activate it within a specific environment.

items.description: List of TLS certificates associated with the specified environment.

timestamp.description: The date and time (UTC) at which the message was logged.

status.description:
Indicates the deployment's status. Valid values are:
  - `created`: The deployment has been created but has not yet been deployed.
  - `uploading`: The CLI is uploading the build. This state is only applicable for EdgeJS deployments.
  - `provisioning`: The CDN is provisioning the environment.
  - `deploying`: The build is being deployed to our network.
  - `waiting`: The build is being propagated throughout our network.
  - `completed`: The build was deployed successfully to our network.
  - `canceled`: The deployment was canceled.
  - `failed`: The deployment has failed.

created_at.description: The date and time (UTC) at which the deployment was submitted.

completed_at.description: The date and time (UTC) at which the deployment was completed.

origins.description:
List of origin configurations.

You cannot delete or change the name of an origin configuration that has been mapped to a hostname. Attempting to do so will generate a `404 Bad Request` whose error message is similar to the following one:

`Invalid config: Schema validation error: properties.0.hostnames.0: Origin 'web' not found`

Defined externally: https://api.vdms.io/cdn/edge-control/v1/configuration/schema#/definitions/property/properties/origins

rules.description:
List of rules defined using JSON syntax.

View your current set of rules in JSON syntax from within the Edgio Console by navigating to the **Rules** page and then clicking **JSON Editor**.

Defined externally: https://api.vdms.io/cdn/edge-control/v1/configuration/schema#/definitions/property/properties/rules

From the Edgio Console, navigate to the desired environment and then click **Settings**. It is listed under **Environment ID**.

purge_cache_on_deploy.description: Overwrite the default value, effectively allowing defining purge cache behaviour with each deployment.

postConfigV01Configs.description: Deploys your configuration to a specific environment. This deployment overwrites any existing origin configurations, hostnames, rules, and experiments.
